alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 1:16PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Bell, southwestern Knox and east central Whitley Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 115 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Permon, or 8 miles southwest of Barbourville, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Carpenter and Siler around 120 PM EDT. Gausdale around 125 PM EDT. Permon and Goins around 130 PM EDT. Clate around 135 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Indian Creek, Birdseye, Barbourville, King, Swan Lake, Swanpond, Bryants Store, Dishman Springs, Hubbs, Boone Heights, Myrick and Brush Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
